question: Which ocean houses the "Kerguelen Islands"?
explanation: The Kerguelen Islands, also known as the Desolation Islands, are part of the French Southern and Antarctic Lands, therefore, an overseas territory of France located in the southern Indian Ocean. These are a group of islands in the Antarctic constituting one of the two exposed parts of the Kerguelen Plateau, a large igneous province mostly submerged by the southern Indian Ocean. They are among the most isolated places on Earth.
